How We Position Consultants

Strategies specifically designed to translate consulting experience into banking language.

Lead with Transaction-Adjacent Work

Due diligence projects, M&A integration, carve-outs, or any transaction-related consulting work should be front and center.

Quantify Financial Impact

Revenue growth, cost savings, EBITDA improvement—frame your consulting wins in terms bankers understand.

Highlight Financial Modeling

Any DCF, valuation, or financial analysis you've done. Consultants often undersell their modeling experience.

Show Industry Depth

If you have sector expertise, emphasize it. Industry knowledge is valuable for coverage groups.

Consulting to Banking Transformations

See how we reframe consulting projects in banking-relevant terms.

M&A Due Diligence Project

Consulting Resume

Conducted due diligence analysis for private equity client evaluating acquisition target

Banking Resume

Led commercial due diligence for $400M PE acquisition of specialty chemicals manufacturer; identified $15M revenue synergy opportunity and 3 key integration risks that informed final bid pricing

Cost Transformation Engagement

Consulting Resume

Worked on cost reduction project for Fortune 500 client

Banking Resume

Developed zero-based budgeting framework for $2B revenue industrial company, identifying $45M annual cost savings (200bps EBITDA margin improvement); built 5-year financial model tracking implementation impact

Growth Strategy Project

Consulting Resume

Created growth strategy and market analysis for technology client

Banking Resume

Built bottom-up revenue model for enterprise SaaS company's expansion into 3 new verticals; analysis supported $50M Series C fundraise at $300M pre-money valuation

Why Consultants Switch to Banking

Want to be closer to transaction execution rather than advisory

Interested in finance and capital markets specifically

Seeking clearer exit opportunities to PE/HF

Want to build technical financial skills

Prefer deal-based work over project-based consulting

The good news: Banks actively recruit from consulting. MBB to banking is a well-worn path. But your resume needs to speak banking language—not consulting language—to get interviews.
